p: Cancer chemoprevention which involves the inhibition or reversion of cancer through the administration of natural or synthetic agents has gained a wider audience in Uganda. Chemopreventive agents may inhibit cancer development either by limiting exposure to carcinogens (carcinogen formation inhibitors and blocking agents) or by decreasing tumor promotion or progression stages (suppressing agents) [ 236]. Many compounds from medicinal or dietary plants have been reported as chemopreventive agents capable of inhibiting DNA damage and retarding or reversing carcinogenesis in in vitro and in vivo bioassays [ 237].
